A4.text: Sir Alexander Fleming was a Scottish physician and microbiologist.

A5.text: Sir Alexander Fleming (6 August 1881 â€“ 11 March 1955) was a Scottish physician and microbiologist, best known for discovering the world's first broadly effective antibiotic substance, which he named penicillin.
